Similar to SARS-CoV infection, MERS-CoV infection manifests as a severe lower respiratory tract infection with extrapulmonary involvement and high fatality rates.
19 Symptomatic patients may present fever, chills, stiffness, myalgia, discomfort, cough, shortness of breath, and gastrointestinal symptoms of diarrhea, vomiting, and abdominal pain. Pneumonia is common, and severe infection with acute respiratory failure, renal failure, and shock is particularly frequent among older patients.
